location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Copy of letter No 3/1 of 1873 from Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, on special duty with the Zanzibar and Muscat Mission, at Aden, to The Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter reporting on his safe arrival at Aden on 2 December 1872, Sir Bartle Frere's arrival there on 31 December 1872 and the arrangements thus far for the mission, including their intention to proceed towards Zanzibar on 4 January 1873.The letter also reports that Lieutenant Edward Mockler has been requested to proceed to Gwadur and officiate for Captain Samuel Barrett Miles.A copy of Pelly's letter to Brigadier General John William Schneider is referred to as enclosed but is no longer with the letter. A copy of this letter can however be found at folio forty-six.
